item.title: Python Learning Progress – Part 4
item.description: Last time I talked about getting input and a little about conditional statement and looping that should’ve enabled you to start creating the basic application and implement some basic algorithm in Python. This time, I am going to do a review on some of the basic data structures in Python. The basic data structures in Python are: list, tuples, and dictionaries. Let me start with dictionaries. Dictionaries basically defines a one-to-one relationship between a key and a value, just like an ordinary dictionary, where a word is associated with its definition.
